title: Mynydd Mawr Walking Route

images.title: Martin Bodman / View of Mynydd Mawr
images.caption: View of Mynydd Mawr. Seen from the Rhyd-ddu - Nantlle road

images.title: John Fielding / The Nantlle Ridge Range from Mynydd Mawr Summit.
images.caption: The Nantlle Ridge Range from Mynydd Mawr Summit 1. The summits of Y Garn, Mynydd Drws-y-coed and Mynydd Tal-y-mignedd dominate the skyline.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Nantlle Ridge from Mynydd Mawr Summit
images.caption: Nantlle Ridge from Mynydd Mawr Summit 2.  A South-southeasterly view.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Mynydd Mawr Summit Cairn
images.caption: Summit Cairn. The summit cairn of Mynydd Mawr looking northwest towards Foel Goch and Moel Cynghorion on the Moel Eilio Ridge. The stoney summit area is scattered with numerous cairns and shelters of all sizes.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Craig y Bera Gulley
images.caption: Craig y Bera Gulley. A southerly view through a rocky gulley in Craig y Bera to the Dyffryn Nantlle valley floor below.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Cwm Planwydd Valley
images.caption: Cwm Planwydd Valley. The Afon Goch in the Cwm Planwydd valley descends to Llyn Cwellyn below with the Moel Eilio range forming the background of the photo.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Drws y Coed from Craig y Bera
images.caption: Drws y Coed from Craig y Bera. A southerly view through a gulley from the top of Craig y Bera at grid reference SH 54367 54218 to Drws-y-Coed in the Dyffryn Nantlle Valley below.

images.title: Terry Hughes / Llyn Cwellyn and the Moel Eilio Ridge
images.caption: Llyn Cwellyn and the Moel Eilio Ridge, near to Betws Garmon, Gwynedd, Great Britain. A northeastern view of Llyn Cwellyn and the entire Moel Eilio Ridge taken from near the summit of Foel Rudd.

description: Climb to the 698 m (2,290 ft) summit Mynydd Mawr on this challenging climb in the Snowdonia National Park. On the walk you will enjoy stunning views of Llyn Cwellyn and the surrounding mountains. The walk starts from the village of Rhyd Ddu and follows woodland trails through Beddgelert Forest before climbing above Llyn Cwellyn to Foel Rudd and then on to the Mynydd Mawr summit. There are interesting geological formations, rocky outcrops and breathtakingly beautiful views to enjoy. It's also a fairly quiet walk with most people heading to Snowdon from Rhyd Ddu. If you'd like to continue your climbing in the area then the Snowdon Rhyd Ddu Path starts from the village too. You could also head along the wonderful Nantlle Ridge .
